headline.main: Ideas & Trends: Fear, Itself; The Right Dose of Scare Tactics

docs.abstract: Scare tactics continue to be used to warn young people off drinking, smoking and sex even though critics doubt if such 'health terrorism' will succeed in long term (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: BE afraid. Be very afraid. This is the message at the heart of public health campaigns that hope to stop young people from unsafe sex, smoking or binge drinking.
docs.snippet: BE afraid. Be very afraid.    This is the message at the heart of public health campaigns that hope to stop young people from unsafe sex, smoking or binge drinking.
